text: "Rub You the Right Way" is a song by Johnny Gill. Taken as the first single from the artist's debut album under the Motown label. The single was written and produced by James Harris III & Terry Lewis. A remixed version of the song exists with a rap verse from CL Smooth. ==Composition== According to Billboard, the song is about sex, more specifically a "man who offers to use his hands wisely during a night of lovin'." ==Chart Performance== "Rub You the Right Way" spent one week in May 1990 at number-one on the US R&B; chart, and made it to number three on the Billboard Hot 100 charts in August of that year. The single also peaked at number sixteen on the dance charts and was Gill's first single upon the breakup of New Edition and his biggest hit to date. ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" !Chart (1990) !Peak position |- |Australia (ARIA) |align="center"|59 |- |Netherlands (Single Top 100) |align="center"|27 |- |New Zealand (Recorded Music NZ) |align="center"|41 |- |UK (Official Charts Company) |align="center"|77 |- |US Billboard Hot 100 |align="center"|3 |- |US Billboard Hot R&B; Singles |align="center"|1 |- |US Billboard Dance Music/Club Play Singles |align="center"|16 |} ===Year-end charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (1990) !Position |- |US Top Pop Singles (Billboard) | style="text-align:center;"|23 |} ==Popular Culture== *The remixed version of the song appeared in the popular video game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, playing on fictional new jack swing radio station CSR 103.9. ==See also== * R&B; number-one hits of 1990 (USA) ==References== Category:Johnny Gill songs Category:1990 songs Category:1990 singles Category:Billboard Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs number-one singles Category:Songs about sexuality Category:Songs written by Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis Category:Song recordings produced by Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis
